clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Primary Care Providers' Knowledge and Beliefs Regarding Gout Management
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Primary Care Providers' Knowledge and Beliefs Regarding Gout Management

brief_summary.textblock: This is a questionnaire study aimed at learning about physicians' views on the treatment of Gout.

detailed_description.textblock:
We seek to assess the knowledge, beliefs and reported treatment practices of primary care physicians with regard to gout.
Specifically, we will:
- Assess the knowledge and beliefs with regard to acute and chronic gout management based on published treatment recommendations.
- Characterize the individuals who have knowledge deficits in terms of age, specialty, number of patients seen with gout, and practice setting.
- Assess the reported treatment practices of primary care physicians for the acute and chronic management of gout.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the knowledge and beliefs with regard to acute and chronic gout management based on published treatment recommendations.
primary_outcome.description: Assess physicians' knowledge and beliefs with regard to acute and chronic gout management based on published treatment recommendations by means of questionnaire.
